title: The best way to stay!
text:
I started using airbnb as a guest mostly. We are always able to find unique places to stay that could accommodate our lifestyle. When you travel as a family you need the comforts of home to really enjoy your time away from home! Airbnb provides choices traditional options just don’t! I love the fact you can live like a local wherever you choose to travel. 
I have since become a host on airbnb and I am part of a family of travelers who expect the unexpected. I have the best time meeting people from all over the country and even the world and providing them with a safe, clean, homey environment that I know they can’t get anywhere else. I am a unique host with unique guests and I love every minute of it! Airbnb has certainly changed the way we travel and has changed the way we see our future! Cheers!

title: App has had no change in years, including bugs.
text: This app is so poorly made, it drives me nuts. If there were a strong alternative to Airbnb, I’d use it immediately. Directions almost never work. Linking to a map application fails every single time. Navigation is poor, as is the photo viewing in different types of views. In some, you can click to view a whole photo, in others you can’t, and those times are usually when you especially want to see an image. Some data is also not saved on the app, so you need access to the internet to see things like conversations with a host. Really critical stuff when you’re traveling abroad with often no internet. This app is the definition of “death by a thousand paper cuts.” I’m only writing this in hopes the dev team will see it and review their priorities. I honestly have not seen a change to this app in three years, which makes me believe they are rebuilding the entire thing. I just reluctantly use the app anyway, because the alternatives are sparse.

title: Guided tour in Pompeii with Marina
text: Hi Antonio, thank you very much for sending Marina to lead the group we joined. She is very knowledgeable, speaks fluent English, very patient, especially with the two of us seniors. We often lagged behind, she was very careful to make sure we were following her. She gave very vivid description of Roman life in Pompeii before the Vesuvius eruption, and then described in detail how the people tried to deal with the disaster, and then how they died. She also told us about the history of the discovery of the buried ruin of Pompeii, the history of various attempts to excavate it, and so on and so forth. She made us want to stay longer and explore more, unfortunately we didn’t have the time, plus being very tired. We really appreciate the experience of touring Pompeii with our wonderful guide Marina. It’s a real treasure for us! Well worth our trip to Napoli! Thanks!

title: Scam and a rip off
text: My wife and I booked a trip at a house to our surprise the air conditioning did not work properly on a 115 degree day we immediately checked out the next morning. The host and Air Bnb declined to give us even just a partial refund for ending our trip early. Instead they kept all the money for all four days the host purposefully would not cancel our trip and the app would not allow us to cancel it after we left either. So in return these people were paid for a four day stay and we only stayed a few hours. I would not recommend anyone use this app unless you want to be ripped off and set back by the financial and physical damages you will receive for choosing to stay with air bnb. I am considering taking legal action against the host and air bnb because our family suffered personal injuries due to the negligence of the host. Not to mention the house had roaches! The economic impact, pain, suffering and emotional distress can not simply be mended with a small apology. DO NOT BOOK WITH AIR BNB THEY WILL SCREW YOU OVER BIG TIME!

title: Might sue you
text: Years ago I was a host and a guest for Airbnb. I had enjoyed the experience up to the point where someone attempted to create a fake profile on myself. I tried everything in my power to rectify the situation. But it seems that the people who work at Airbnb lack basic common sense. Now today these people have an unauthorized photo of me and their database. I have made several request for them to remove it but they refused. They also refused to let me back on the platform because in their minds I violated the terms of agreement. But that is not true another user violated their terms and use me as a guinea pig. I have no control over what someone does.  The picture they kept of me was taken from a surveillance video while checking into a guarded gate community. I’m pretty sure either way they never let me back on the platform that is their decision. But the fact that they have an unauthorized photo of me and other information I don’t think you are allowed to do that and I may take legal action against you.

title: LEFT STRANDED IN A DIFFERENT CITY!!!
text:
We booked a place months in advanced and yet airbnb failed to inform us the place was canceled despite the host informing them with plenty of time beforehand. They left us with no place to stay the day of our trip after we arrived. Then continued to be of no help and take days to respond. Very disappointed about this awful experience and no help to make up for their awful mistake. To add insult to injury AirBnB held on to our full payment and indicated we will not receive a refund for up to 15 days!!! Then redacted on their promise to cover a new place even taking our money for the new place, after we requested refund. Still no response in regards to the refund we were promised by two separate employees for the new place and never received a the call they promised me three separate times I would be receiving.

 DO NOT USE AIRBNB EVER!! Not worth the risk of being stuck in a different city with no place to go and the terrible response from Airbnb to the situation. Would give airbnb negative stars if possible.

title: Terrible customer support system.
text:
Have never really had an issue with Airbnb until I had a house cancel their reservation on me. Most of the other properties in the area booked up, prices went through the roof. Things happen. But the process to contact support is terrible. Takes days for them to even respond to you in the chat, which in that time span other remaining properties are being booked, and the average price of the remaining spots increases. After a long delay in their initial response they then lied about how they would help compensate me. 

I accepted their initial offer of compensation, asked how to retrieve it in the chat and it took almost two days for a follow up answer, at which point they told me they couldn’t actually give me what they promised. I’m assuming it was a completely different person who I was talking to since it was such a long time in between responses. 

The app is fine for booking and searching for places. But if you ever run into the unfortunate situation of actually needing help you’re in trouble, especially if you’re in a time crunch.

title: Overall, its incredible! But I have a couple of simple app suggestions...
text:
I used this app on a light and fast cycle tour across France, and overall I really love the app and the service. Its truly incredible, and opens up so many opportunities for travel and exciting new experiences. I like that the messenger in the app is connected to Google translate- it makes traveling in other countries with languages I’m not fluent in a breeze.

However, I have a suggestion for the app’s messenger- every time I’ve used it, I’ve been with a friend, and I would really like the option to add my travel partner(s) to a group chat. It would make communicating with hosts and travel partners much easier and more precise. Everyone in the group (usually a pair for me) would know how to get into the places we’re staying, know the specific rules of the home, and the host’s preferences for different things.

Thanks for such a great service!!

title: Cozy Corner @ Ty’s by the pool
text: Hello everyone. This was my first stay in an Airbnb and now I’m so spoiled. The Cozy Corner room @ Ty’s was prefect for me. It was secluded, quite and absolutely beautiful. The bed was so comfortable I didn’t want to get up and run around San Diego. FYI - a lot of times I just stayed in the room ;) The amenities Ty offers are better then any hotel stay. Meaning: full common area usage that has everything a home would have and then some. Plus your room is equipped with a smartTv, streaming apps and more. Ty has even made sure each bathroom has little toiletries for her guest. Ty’s is now locked in as my preferred San Diego Airbnb. Ty was also very helpful with information about San Diego, recommendations to fix my personality and very responsive to my questions and concerns. I could go on and on. Instead I highly recommend you stay there and get experience. Hugs.

title: Cancelled Our Stay 2 weeks Before Flight
text: 2 weeks before our flight to New York for Fashion Week, the hosts and Airbnb cancelled our trip due to law changes in NYC surrounding Airbnbs. All Airbnb was willing to do was give us $50 credit and help us find another stay, but none of the remaining available stays compare to what we had booked. Our flights are economy and non-refundable as well. We do not make a lot of money, we are artists working pro-bono backstage and the big allure in the stay we chose is that it was beautiful and cozy, a place for us to stay in and cook to save money. We booked our stay over two months ago. Hotels price gouge during NYFW and Airbnbs are scarce this time of the year.  They absolutely refused to do anything else, more credit, compensate our flights even a small percentage, wave booking and cleaning fees, nothing. This is really a blow for us, we’ve been working so hard for this trip and the rug was ripped out from under our feet. We will never book with Airbnb again, I hope this company collapses.

title: Be Advised… (BEWARE)
text: I made a reservation for my family and I to stay at a tiny lodge in Orlando Fl for April 19-20 on March 23, nearly a month in advance. I have screenshots of msgs between myself and the host describing my reasons for the reservation and how many, after that they accepted the reservation. Today less than a week from my reservation they cancelled saying they could not accommodate children under age 13; mins you this alteration to their listing was made AFTER my reservation had been accepted, confirmed, and paid for. It’s less than a week from the day I’ve taken off work to spend in Seaworld and I must wait 15 days for my full refund of nearly $250. So again I’m less than a week from the day I need a room, I don’t have the reservation money as they waited too late for me to use it on another reservation and I can’t undo my day off at work at this point. Keep in mind while using the app the HOST can literally discriminate in any way and alter their listing after reservation confirmation to Avoid servicing you. BEWARE

title: Bad for long stays
text: If you need to stay somewhere a month or more I would recommend finding another app. Air Bnb does not care if the units are furnished in any way and you are unable to get any mail service during your stay. I moved into an air bnb for a little over a month for work, had to buy all my own pots, pans, trash cans, towels, cutlery, ect, ect. Shortly after moving in my appendix burst and I had to stay in the hospital for a week. The hospital bills were sent to my air bnb. The owners refused to allow me to check the mailbox and told me to wait by the boxes for the mailman. I had to wait by the mail for 2 hours with drainage tubes hanging out of my stomach and sit through a decent amount of pain. Definitely not how I would expect to be treated by an airbnb property. Solidly the opposite experience from what I have had with my short rentals. Overall I am not going to use air bnb moving forward, as the market has too much competition to warrant spending my money there.

title: Disabling accounts left and right
text: Im not sure what’s going on with this company lately, but I’m extremely disappointed with Airbnb. I’ve had this app for several years and have enjoyed the novelty of staying in someone’s home rather than a hotel, however, after not using the app for several months I came back to find my account had been deactivated. After doing some research, I found many other users with the same complaint, both hosts and guests. I emailed asking for an explanation and after some “review” received and email stating that I would not be able to use the platform in the future and that my account had been deactivated, saying they were not obligated to explain why. I decided to message them on Facebook, and after another short “review” got another email stating that the decision was final. I’ve had nothing but good reviews and only stayed at a handful of places. My boyfriends account was also deactivated with no explanation. Not sure why such a large corporation would want to eliminate all of their paying customers. 🤷🏼‍♀️

title: Great service, ok application
text:
Overall, Airbnb is amazing. It makes traveling more affordable and comfortable. You also have a resource within the city which is really nice.

The app has a few problems, notably that when you try to scroll back in messages it jumps to the bottom which can be very frustrating if you’ve had a lot of conversation with someone and need to look back. Also, it would be nice if the house rules in the description also came up on your reservation. Having a separate section for house rules/manual in the actual booking is confusing, and I’ve missed things that were on the listing but not the booking.

It would also be nice to have a section where the host explicitly says what they expect the guest to clean, etc when leaving. This feels separate from house rules and varies from place to place-ie beds stripped or not, dishes put away, etc.

title: AI will decide your fate and customer service is a joke
text: The use of AI bots can really limit your ability to use this service. As mentioned in a recently published article, AI is being used to flag users trying to book for parties using information like, age, duration of the stay, quantity of guests, and booking entire houses “last minute”. When traveling as a family I absolutely prefer a place with a kitchen, multiple toilets, and a living room so being automatically declined for booking “an entire house” and receiving a 10 day suspension along with a note recommending I book at a hotel or apartment is truly disappointing. I also had a host approved booking cancelled automatically by Airbnb because it was booked “last minute”. My host let me know that it’s all a go then let me know I withdrew my request. After approval! It’s almost as if some hosts don’t seem to mind a five night stay booked between weekend bookings. I should have known exactly to a T when I’d be traveling and maybe robots would be able to approve me.

title: DO NOT BOOK THROUGH THEM
text: I booked a property through them a month or less ago and it was probably the WORST experience I’ve ever had. We flew in to our destination, went to the property during the check in time. The host was not responding at all, we looked around and the property was literally so filthy and disgusting just by looking at the outside. The host never responded, reached out to customer service where they were no help what so ever. Told us we had to wait until the host refunded us. Did not care to help get us a refund or into another property. We had to get a hotel instead for the rest of our stay and did not get refunded until 10 business days. Then, i made a mistake on my end and booked another property for another upcoming trip we have just for them to say that I was committing identity theft and blocked me and now won’t refund my down payment until 10 business days. I recommend going through VRBO, I never have had one issue going with them. Airbnb will never be recommended in my book.

title: How I lost 1k using Airbnb and discover that the worst cases /reviews are not allowed on the system
text: I rented a place for 3k in Airbnb to stay in San Diego in June. The host never answered, two weeks before my stay that I booked a month in advance, and after a week of communications Airbnb accepted to cancel and reimburse the 3k but now the cheapest similar place was over 4k. Airbnb gave a coupon of 300 dollars , I lost 1k even after using that coupon. The big issue is that I am not able to leave a review for that host. This means that the worst scenarios, which is arriving to a place and not be able to enter, are not registered in the platform for other users to see. Cases when u will have to stay in the street or pay a last minute expensive place are not registered on the platform!!!!! so how would u trust the reviews in the listings? Or airbnb at all? A person before me on that listing had that experience, she was able to review because the reservation was not canceled, in fact, she had no place to stay the night she got there

title: A new way to work, live, and travel
text:
Airbnb is constantly improving their app, making it one of the best designed and elegant workflows of any application out there. I use this application as a host and guest, as many of us do, and have found great experiences on both sides. Latest update is fantastic and I love to see Airbnb encouraging more people to become hosts. 

There aren’t many apps on my phone that I would say changed my life, Airbnb has. Through it we’ve been able to achieve more financial independence, work experience, and nicer homes while more or less living our everyday lives. It’s hard work, no doubt, and it helps you to connect with more people around the world, to showcase your area and your home.

As a traveler, the feeling of walking into a neighborhood and settling down into a home sets an entirely different tone as a traveler. It’s hard to explain and easy to understand. 

At this point this review could be speaking to all those who already know how great Airbnb is. I hope this is helpful to someone out there who is still on the fence whether to try it. Truly a company that set out to change the world and they’ve done just that in such a positive way, from my perspective.

title: Deleting this app
text: The last two vacations I made through Airbnb were a disappointment. Problem is when you leave a bad review, all the host would do is not respond to it that and voila, no negative reviews on their websites at all. On the last vacation, I even tried to cancel way before the 14 day policy and it doesn’t matter because the host doesn’t have a cancellation policy, in the end airbnb will always have the host back and not the customer. I don’t even understand why their always charges cleaning fees when it is us guest who cleans but I have been using Airbnb for 5 years and I never really questioned it till now. But after these two listings that are just a disaster on my part, I’m deleting this app and going back to hotel again. I have lost enough money and frankly, at least in hotel. You can reschedule and rebook without having to worry about fees and or penalties or having clean your room or throw your trash after. So goodbye airbnb.

title: AirBnb Canceled my Honeymoon!!!
text:
My wife and I got married in July. We decided to postpone our honeymoon until after the Christmas season. She is a student and I own a jewelry business so we decided that it would be best to wait until after the holidays to travel. 
I have been a loyal customer with Airbnb for years, and have only received stellar reviews from renters.
Yesterday evening I felt my phone buzzing repeatedly and when I checked, Airbnb had canceled all of our reservations and hotels that we were going to visit in the Yucatán Peninsula.
When I looked for an explanation, Airbnb stated that they had run some form of API software to do background checks and discovered that I had a criminal record, and therefore they disabled my account. This is not right, and I do not have any charges on my permanent record, so clearly there technology has found the record of somebody else with my same name, or the system is simply wrong. I have reached out to Airbnb twice since then and they have only returned an email that states that they have reviewed the file and have determined that they can’t reinstate my account. They have given me no reasons or any evidence of what they are saying, and will not do anything to help me, and have affectively labeled me a criminal and ruined my wife and my honeymoon unapologetically. 

I am sad and disappointed, and don’t have any recourse to deal with this situation, because the company has no customer service or accountability.

title: AirBnb Doesn’t Care About Guest Experience
text:
My friend booked a stay on her account, and she and I split the cost, and she added me as a guest. While at the house, problems arose and so I messaged both the Host and AirBnb support for help. The property manager ignored most of our issues and told me that “unfortunately your group chose to book the home” so there would be no partial refund despite our long list of issues. 

And because I wasn’t the one who originally booked the stay, AirBnb denied the claim bc my friend didn’t submit the claim “during our stay” - even though I did. But I was just a guest, not the one who booked the house, so they didn’t care.

The issues we experienced that were ignored are as follows: 

- had to call the manager 3 times to have him remotely open the front door
- deck propane tank leaks gas when fireplace turned on
- air filter in living room has a thick layer of dust
- dishwasher broken
- fridge ice dispenser gets stuck in the on position
- dead bug smeared on the walls, dead bugs on many windows sills
- living room furniture different than listing pictures
- pool table cues all had broken tips
- downstairs closet door handle broken into the door
- porch door stuck shut and could sometimes be opened with great force
- cobwebs inside
- wasps nest on front porch
- broken blinds in living room
- kitchen cupboards stuck shut upon arrival

and all of this for about $900 per night. It was advertised as a new luxury lake house but it was a mess.

title: Glitches and non transparency
text: Throughout the years I have been a very loyal member of the Airbnb however the past year has made me wish I went with another app or just want to head and booked a hotel there have been times where I am showed one price and when I go to check out it’s something astronomically higher and despite me complaining to hear baby there’s never any kind of responsibility taken from them this is happened multiple times to me aside from that and whenever I try to get the communication with them I will consistently get notification saying that someone has messaged me however whenever I do go and check the messages there’s nothingOr I would have to wait a couple hours for it to go ahead and reload however this is just kind of unacceptable you know I wish that they could’ve done something to continue upon their great customer service but as of lately it’s just been like every time I turn around it’s something that I’m being disappointed about

title: Horrible
text: This is the first (and absolute last) time my wife has tried Airbnb. Your site is, without exception, the most useless and user unfriendly site we have experienced. There is no help, the system is beyond confusing. It took us two hours communicating with the owner over the “reply” system just to finally get the reservation and we find out today that the reservation was canceled because my wife’s picture “wasn’t clear enough). We didn’t open the message in time and as a result we are now “homeless”. We needed the house to stay in while we closed on our current home and than closed on our new home -a one week difference. I am beyond angry with your useless site. I, clearly, will never use your site again and I will go out of my way to badmouth Airbnb and advise anyone who asks me not to use Airbnb. I will spread this experience we have had as often as I can. My only hope is that it will cause some people who might otherwise use Airbnb, not to.  I want to thank you for making a stressful time even more stressful.

title: Okay service
text: We just used Airbnb to travel through France. We found that sometimes it was better to book a hotel room through other sites. If you are renting a whole place for an extended time it is probably great. For a room for the night it is not the best. We ended up in a kids bed for the night because we booked last minute, the host asked us to arrive late, and when we arrived she told us she overbooked and the room she advertised was not available. At that point it was late and we had no place else to go. In the morning she asked us not to write a review because she was getting divorced and didn’t want her husband to know we had been there. That is an awkward situation that you don’t deal with at a hotel. I also think it is hard to pinpoint the location of where you are staying if you are not familiar with an area you might end up in a residential area far (20 mins or more) from where you want to be.

title: Overall great!
text:
It is overall a great platform, but I would suggest a couple of modifications.

Using the app vs the website - the app makes it difficult to see the specifics on what kinds of beds there are and what sizes. (EXAMPLE - Pull out couch vs Normal bed vs Blow up bed; and Queen vs Double vs Full).

I understand that an app can’t have ALL functionality of a full website, but the beds seem like a very basic essential factor to understand when choosing a place to stay - especially with multiple people.

Also - I HATE THAT AIRBNB ONLY GIVES A SHORT WINDOW OF TIME TO LEAVE PEOPLE REVIEWS!!!! What the crap is with that?! I think it’s like 3 weeks, which makes zero sense to me. AirBnB is sacrificing a large percentage of reviews because of that, which makes their platform less appealing and which means less likely to be utilized. 

I literally just left my first review today after what has probably been my 10th stay...because typically I am either still traveling in the time after I stayed at someone’s place, or I’m trying to get caught back up on my real life once I get home. So who has the time to leave reviews within 3 weeks and WHYYYYYYYY would you force that?!

Aside from price, I will always book through the platform that has the larger number of reviews so that I have the best chance that they are accurate.

title: Dangerous Situation - attempted car theft and AirBnB is unresponsive
text:
I’ve been a huge fan of AirBnB but after this situation, I will think twice before renting an AirBnB. There is NO timeline to resolve this very real safety issue and the application does not have a way to report safety issues. You have to work with a team that seems to lose most of your notes from contact point to contact point. 

My car was parked in the provided parking on the street right beside my room. The room was a carriage house above a garage. There was no lock from the inside—only a flimsy latch—so it was only a garage door between me and whichever criminal broke into and ruined my car. The same night, other crimes took place on the same street. I spent a night of my stay waiting for the police to make a report and then for my car to get towed. 

I obviously did not feel safe. I told the host I would be checking out and handed her the key. She said I needed to work through the app to figure out the cancellation policy. It has been a week and I still have no resolution from AirBnB and at this point am on the hook for almost $1000 for nights I did not stay after being victim to a serious crime while I stayed at the property. This is completely unacceptable and would never happen in a hotel. 

I’m so disappointed and want to share this experience with other guests who might consider an AirBnB. Be warned: think twice before choosing an AirBnB over a hotel.

title: And ongoing app issue.
text: This app has an ongoing issue of having errors during payment methods. You could be paying with a Airbnb gift card that covers the whole expense of the trip only for it to pop up an error message saying. “ we are performing a routine review on your reservation. This should be resolved soon”  only for it to not be resolved because nobody knows what’s the problem and it has me sit and wait hours, making me lose my reservation, making me stranded for them to not have solution to the problem. they act like they’re sorry, leaving me stranded and not compensating. I could be paying with my debit card and I would still have this issue. They don’t put any effort to fix this problem. Anytime I take my card off my account and add a different one they flag it and tell me I can’t book for 24 hours. Which I find ridiculous. their app has so much problems that they have no effort to fix. There’s times I have been scammed in AIRBNB and they had not compensate me for my money

title: Great until you run into an issue
text: I use Airbnb a lot. I love it for getaways and friends trips. But not anymore. The customer service is awful. I recently had an awful experience with a month full of bugs, dirt, trash and broken showers. They kept reading a script on me and didn't actually want to help me at all. They offered $200 out of a $2500 trip which was kind of insulting. They then lowered it to only $100. I paid my hard earned money to stay in an awful place. They kept telling me I didn't report my findings in time when I had documentation that I did but no one cared what I had to say. I requested a full refund from a multi million dollar company and got no response from the host then I got barely a response from Airbnb. I understand they aren't responsible for the actual listing but they should cater to the host and guest alike to make sure experiences through them are fair and good quality. I had neither so I will be switching to another app. It was a good company in my eyes until true colors showed.

title: Airbnb doesn’t care about your safety
text: I exposed a host who is anti-vax and puts my health at risk, in addition to many of her horrendous treatments of her guest when you refuse to bow down to her unreasonable demands not in the house rules. I believe potential guests would find my review very helpful in deciding what they might get themselves into and how to protect their health. Airbnb removed my review saying it contains irrelevant information without giving me a chance to edit and resubmit. So this host will continue to stay a “superhost” because most of her guests are short-term so they never got the chance to see her true self like I did when I spent three months with her, and long-term guests will be screwed. Airbnb avoided my support request since then, saying supervisor will contact me but never did. During my conflicts with the host, Airbnb also provided very little support and I was eventually forced to move out due to the lack of support. It’s truly a disappointing experience and I’ve been a guest since 2014. I will not use Airbnb again.

title: DONT USE THIS APP, WORST SERVICE EVER
text: never use this App, they don't care about you, they only care about the hosts, I accidentally paid a reservation in turkey rental vacation in colorado I just saw that it was a mistake literally a minute I called to cancel the booking and they canceled it and not They returned the money, they told me it was my fault for paying it, even when I explained on several occasions that it was a mistake and it was immediately reported, they don't care about you, they just want to keep the host happy, I feel like they scammed me, they didn't give me back the money, nor did they allow me change the reservation for another day be careful what you do this app I recommend using verbo they have a better cancellation policy and are more professional or any other app, I feel like they robbed me, no one helped me, they left it in the hands of the host and the host simply didn’t  care, immediately delete the app please take the time to read the bad reviews and you will see that many people have been scammed.

title: Excellent hosts!
text: Arrived early and we were able to check in right away. unit we rented only had a mini fridge in it that was clearly stated in information, that we over looked. We were able to look at all units and pick the one we wanted for no change in cost.  We choose a different unit and we were very pleased. The unit was very clean and stocked.  The view and sounds of river were very nice.   Amanda, the host was very sweet, after working all day came and made up all the beds in the new unit for us and was very patient and kind with our children. Amanda showed the children around the property, the fish pond etc. and had her boys set up the fire ring for us and even offered marshmallow for them! A definitely peaceful place to vacation at very low cost! Do not expect luxury but clean, comfortable with beautiful views! Will return.

title: Horrible Experience
text: This app is completely horrible!!!! I made a reservation from my account. They locked and removed my account without any notice, and i know and i am sure i have never done anything wrong, in fact i have used airbnb before. There is no direct line to contact them. Anyway they said they will refund me for my booking, god knows when that will come back, I am stranded in the middle of the street, with half of money gone, not knowing when it will come back, and no one to contact. So I made another account wuth my other email, booked another place, everything was set, then i get an email that my account is locked and deleted AGAIN!!! I can guarantee i have never done anything for them to be doing this to me, it is so inconvenient, they put my safety and my money at risk, now I spent all my money on the bookings, made the same mistake twice, my fault on that, i dont have no money and no place to go!!! This is the worst experience of my life! And thanks for getting rid of my account because I would've done it myself anyway!

title: Very disappointed
text: I never ever review anything, but I feel compelled to do this. I used the app to book a place for a client of mine. I guess my client and the owner of the place he stayed exchanged words. Now, I have no connection to the property.. never set foot on it. Air B&b allowed me to use my account for someone else, his information was still uploaded into the system so they knew who was staying there. I complied with the owners request for my client to leave and told him he could not stay there any longer. I was also told that I would not be penalized for the actions of someone else, yet air b&b suspended my account and will not allow me to ever use their company again. I was not given and explanation as to why I am the one who is being penalized. Also, it’s impossible to talk to an actual person to even plead my case. I’m unhappy with how this whole situation was handled. If the person who books the apartment is going to be the one penalized for someone else’s behavior, then they should not allow people to make reservations on behalf of someone else. I’m furious.

title: Prices have gone up a lot
text: I used to use Airbnb as a fun affordable alternative to hotels when I traveled. Unfortunately you can’t really do that anymore with how much prices have gone up- especially cleaning fees. It’s a lot more expensive than a hotel at this point and most of the time you don’t even get the privacy of a hotel because you’re staying in a room at someone’s house. I understand it costs money to clean, but when some of the cleaning fees double the price of our stay it’s a little confusing. Hard to see how one night will cost 60$ to clean up, especially when it’s customary to clean up after yourself. Airbnb should find a way to regulate this because it’s really disappointing to see what looks like a cheap fun stay for 105 and then realize you’re going to be spending over 200 for a tiny room in someone’s house once the cleaning fee and Airbnb service fee are added in. It’s just not worth it when hotels are half the price and give you free breakfast.

title: Don’t Use Airbnb!
text: I booked a room in the beginning of January for February and the day before my check in date Airbnb deleted the whole account and cancelled the reservation that I PAID MY MONEY FOR with no reasoning at all I called three different times all they would tell me is they don’t know and that I’ll get my money back in 5-7 days. Then I booked again and it comes to the time I’m suppose to check in and no ones answering I called the host text the host and all she didn’t answer so I called Airbnb ONCE AGAIN and they only told me to keep trying to get into contact and they will call me back in 15 minutes and finally the host contacted me saying she thought it was cancelled Airbnb contacted her saying that the page was deleted again with no explanation. I have lost over 300 dollars that I needed and no I have to wait 5- 7 days for all my money and I then had family from California come to visit with no place to stay it’s so unprofessional and they don’t tell you anything or give you a reasoning for anything I would rather get a hotel

title: Horrible
text: Unreliable, they drag their feet to fix any issues I’ve ever had or extreme delay to reply to any of my concerns. Took weeks to get money back for one booking where a guy literally became mentally abusive and felt physically unsafe around  so I had to cancel the rest of my stay and that took weeks to fix! Not the most safe app if you’re a female especially as they don’t do much background Checkings on the hosts . Airbnb cares mostly about your money not safety . Also if you book a place and it’s status is “pending to be accepted” by the host they still charge your credit card automatically which is so stupid and inconvenient because now you have to wait till the transaction goes through and then get your money back to your account later.. while you wait you can’t really afford to use your credit card till you get your money back . Also the prices are consistently going up and down while they likely pocket that money .. Frauds!! Can’t wait till a better app comes around to wipe the out of business .. karma! :)

title: Room to improve
text: I really like airbnb and use it often to see what’s it there. I like that you can search whole countries and such. But although there are many filters there are a few I wish I could search by. For example; indoor pool, private pool and Iv noticed that when I use the filter search “entire place to myself” there are still properties listed that have the host staying in the property with you. Also I’d like to be able search specific things like “indoor pool” again in the search bar if there can’t be a filter or city/states specific filters like cabin in the mountains or 420 friendly properties in legal states. Also most properties that come up are not close to the destination I’m looking for. There should also be a filter for no camera properties where my family can be a little paranoid and don’t like the idea of being watched by a stranger.

userName: is this serious or a joke?
title: Terrible experience, first time using
text: I am a travel nurse and decided to use Airbnb for my stay. I have a ton of issues with the property and the host. I have tried to reach out to Airbnb customer service many times. I was told twice that I could cancel my reservation and not pay any fees. I was about to do this, but thank god I called again because it turns out I would’ve been out 3,500$ and been staying in my car. Your team is not knowledgeable, and every time I have called to speak to someone to further help me, they state that they will page the person working with me, and I end up waiting hours with no call back. I am stuck in a property with a host that is terrible, and Airbnb is doing nothing about it. Please, reconsider your decision and go with a company that will actually help you put your needs first. I have had safety issues, car issues from parking, and issues such as problems with the AC and a bed that smells of pee. Airbnb does not care about me, and they won’t care about you.

title: Horrible customer service
text: We booked a trip for summer of 2020 to go to Disney world for our honeymoon. We had to cancel due to the pandemic and the fact that we are military and are stationed in Japan. We were given orders by the US military banning us from travel so it was impossible to go on our trip. I tried to get a refund for the trip and was told to call back in a month or so when  Airbnb’s policies were updated. I did so and after giving them all the proper documentation and order papers, I was told that we didn’t qualify and I would get nothing back from the $500 I spent. How does being literally ORDERED by the military not qualify? The customer service was extremely rude. We lost our wedding, trip, honeymoon, and $1,500 all at once and the customer service people treated me like I was stupid and acted as if I was a huge inconvenience. It makes me not want to use Airbnb again. The customer service representatives were condescending and mean, for lack of a better word. I’m really bad with confrontation and I felt very taken advantage of by the company.

title: Terrible experience. My 30 B-day trip experience.
text: I am so very shocked by Airbnb services. I’ve contacted them twice regarding a security issue I had with a host and they didn’t even have the courtesy to contact me back. Well, I am sure I won’t be using this service anymore and definitely won’t be recommending it to any either. Here in Qatar, no one trust it anyway and people been discouraging me from using Airbnb but they were right and I was very wrong to go against what’s better. I rented an apartment from an Airbnb listing only to find out that the apartment’ host doesn’t have a permit to actually rent the apartment, the lift was almost taken out of order and the internet was down for almost half of the trip oh and I arrived to an apartment where tile work was being in the process right by it. I basically paid for way too noisy place and services that I didn’t get. And guess what? That was during a trip I booked for my 30th birthday. Terrible experience to say the least. Also, they didn’t let me submit a review of my experience. TERRIBLE! 👎👎👎👎👐

title: Airbnb deletes negative reviews from customers
text: They deleted a negative review I left about a host stating they do not allow “biased” reviews.  We stayed at this property for 5 nights, and one night had another family of four stay the night.  Our host was keeping tabs via a camera at the front door, noticed we had extra people at the house, messaged me about it, I confirmed they spent one night, he said I had to pay extra, 15 minutes later he filed a formal complaint against me.  The listing for the property made no mention of extra charges for extra people.  I had no problem paying the extra, but it would have been nice to know this upfront, and it would have been nice if the host didn’t file a formal complaint.  I left him a negative review, he left me a negative review (even though he got his extra money).  So Airbnb deletes my negative review because it’s biased, but they leave his negative review of me.  I deleted my account, and deleted their app from all my devices.  Use it at your own risk.

title: Beware of unwanted accidental bookings
text:
I recently had an issue with the Airbnb app on my iPhone automatically booking a reservation for a condo with a strict cancellation policy.   I didn’t have the opportunity to select a payment method and I had two saved methods nor did I accept the cancellation terms or confirm the booking.   I simply closed the app after clicking on the reserve button to see the all in costs and I received an email saying I had a confirmed booking.  I was shocked. 

I highly advise you to not save payment methods as AirBnB refused to give me my money back and wanted to adhere to only 50% refund even though I immediately contacted them and the host to make them aware of this issue.  Thank goodness the host agreed to give me my money back after I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau against AirBnB and the property management company.  I also advise you to NEVER click the reserve button to see the all in cost for a property that doesn’t at least allow cancellations in a 48 hour window .

title: Robbed, Forgotten, and Dismissed
text: I have never felt the need to ever write a review on any product and / or service - until today. Six of my friends and I traveled to Barcelona and booked an Airbnb. Our entire place was robbed within 24 hours of checking in - passports, credit cards, cash, computers, cloths. According to the Barcelona police many Airbnb are used as a trap for visitors. One of most incredible parts of this journey has been the utter disregard by Airbnb corporate. No call backs, limited email follow ups, comically ridiculous solutions. The customer service is absolutely atrocious and clearly shows no regard for their customers. Please also note that while Airbnb covers damage to hosts it does not cover damages to guests. What is also shocking is that immediately after getting robbed (with the police suspecting a trap) Airbnb will continue to list that apartment on their website for booking with no warning whatsoever. Everyone be careful out there and if you can just book area hotel. Saving money now doesn’t mean anything when you have been robbed blind.

title: Terrible Service - Host Stole From Me
text: Airbnb doesn’t do well with customer service.  I am a new Airbnb user.  I booked a room for Valentine’s Day weekend.  My room was host told me to cancel the room because he couldn’t chance the book date and need to do maintenance . I cancelled and only received half of my money...basically if the host cancels they get a penalty, so being a new user they took advantage of me.       I made multiple attempts to contact customer service by calling and via message.  They said they have to escalate my call but never call back and via message they close my case.  I WILL never use Airbnb again and suggest you do not attempt to if you don’t want to be swindled.  Not only that...I booked restaurants and event based on my Airbnb...not it’s so hard to find something nearly as close or ideal.  Very disappointing.  Even the $40 coupon I received because my friend sent and invite to first time users I don’t think you could pay me to use this.  It’s simply customer service...at this point I see Airbnb doesn’t VALUE THE CUSTOMER.

title: Excellent Source of Income and way to know people
text:
I love this app.  I help a lot of clients start their own business with this app.  One thing tho it’s if there’s a way to offer a review on the guest. Something similar to what Uber does where drivers can rate their customers.  I say this because it can help you understand how to deal with certain guest better.  In a way you’ll be better prepare as a host when you know certain guests prefer certain accommodations. 

It could be something like leaving a star rating as well as accomplishments that better describe the guest like : Clean, Flexible, Fast reviewer or something like that.  But I think if we as Hosts are being reviewed by guest we should be able to do the same thing with the people coming into our homes.

title: More instant book requirements please
text:
STOP ALLOWING REVIEWS ON CANCELLED RESERVATIONS!!! 

They have never stayed and one or both parties cancelled for a reason why do you want negative reviews hurting hosts and therefore YOUR business? Focus on reviews from people who have actually entered a listing and met a host.

Also you force searchers to have a default setting for instant book that’s not fair to users that like me are female and dont feel comfortable hosting males because I live alone. If people want instant book they can select it don’t make it default. Also, provide WAY more preferences for instant book like female ONLY and number of positive reviews and then girls like me could turn instant book on. (There are some creeps on Airbnb!)

Also you’re extremely glitchy my price is different all the time like smart pricing is on but it’s OFF so I’m also losing business because my listing shows up in search as $64 not $44 and I’ve been dealing with customer service for a month over this it’s still glitching on phone app. Customer service people don’t understand English or problems 80% of the time. Please fix this, it seems like the app designers do whatever they want dismissing non instant book listings and changing listing prices. Respect your hosts they’re your entire business.

You need more intelligent people to improve review guidelines and instant book parameters.

title: Airbnb only takes care of host very well
text:
If you have a property to host, you should go for it because Airbnb will definitely protect you from guests whatever it takes. Your slight complaints will be accepted well by Airbnb, and Airbnb take enough action to erase even tiny complaints. Meanwhile, if you are guest, Airbnb wouldn’t help you at all. Even when host insults you, Airbnb will take 0 care about it. After complaining, I got bunch of insulting words from Airbnb through the text message. Also, the host went for rating manipulative action first by starting a negotiation asking if we will not give bad rating on the property and bad review when they refund as I found a rodent in the property. I just refused it. Airbnb’s decision on this: guest tried review manipulation meanwhile host is innocent. I asked for the action on host for weeks to Airbnb, but they did not take any action on host, but they chose to remove my review with rodent in the property.
If you are planning to host, you should def go for it! Even when it has rodents!

title: Failure
text: We would like to bring this to notice, we recently booked a villa through AirBNB for 4,500 INR in Mahabaleshwar, we planned this gateway after so long with my cousins, we skipped all the other deals as we loved this villa at first site! Apparently because of some airbnb glitch they cancelled our booking on their own without any communication! And now they’ve asked to pay 5 times more than the original price to stay there! It was poorest service of all the time and we are extremely disappointed as now we don’t have booking to the place we’re going! The housekeeper in the scene is being supportive, but as a compony airbnb needs to pay attention to this matter and resolve it for us with courtesy to inform us before the cancellation as well as find a place to stay for our trip in same budget and same facility! Looks like they’re not even aware of their own glitch and we’re the one paying for it! Worst experience ever! Wish they had better service and communication skills!

title: The Captain’s house is family friendly
text: We went with a large family with a variety of ages and this was a great place for relaxation, comfort, fun and making vacation memories. Erica is a top notch hostess and her appreciation for the arts, history and fun are demonstrated throughout. For those who like warm baths, a big fully equipped kitchen and a large table to eat at- you’ll find it here. If you are a music lover she has a record player with speakers throughout the first floor with an eclectic range of records and CD’s. There are also two keyboards. For young children there are plenty of places to sit and play, a backyard to play in and a large wrap around porch as well. It’s a great house with a lot of bedrooms and bathrooms. It’s a true gem and my family and I would highly recommend the captain’s house.

title: It’s okay… sometimes
text:
I have 2 complaints for Airbnb:

1) Little accountability for hosts. 
2) Confusing pricing. 

Recently, I had a host cancel last minute because she tested positive for Covid. Completely understandable. However, I was in a bind for a last minute reservation. 

I applied for a couple places. A day later the hosts would say, “Oh I’m using the room during those dates, sorry.”  Why aren’t the hosts required to blackout the dates? I was losing a day each time. This half hearted accounting for vacancy was putting me in an ever more severe time crunch. Then there was no method to review the host for poor business practices (Apparently only a confirmed stay can review. ) This part of the process needs to be revised. 

Second, pricing. On the map feature, a price would be advertised… that had little or no correlation to actual price. I had to go through everyone to see what the actual price was. Changes for discounts and service/cleaning fees could change the price significantly up or down. The price of the stay needs to be shown to streamline the selection process. 

The idea of Airbnb is great… and has changed travel for the better. However, the execution could be improved. Filters for private bath or entrance would be helpful. I’m too old to share a head at this point.  Hopefully, the app can be developed to aid and hold non-committed hosts to some account.
